verses.esv:
A Song of Ascents. Of David.

122:1   I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let us go to the house of the LORD!”
verses.kjv: 1 I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.
verses.niv: 1 I rejoiced with those who said to me, "Let us go to the house of the LORD."

verses.esv: 25 not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.
verses.kjv: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.niv: 25 Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another--and all the more as you see the Day approaching.

verses.esv: 20 For where two or three are gathered in my name, there am I among them.”
verses.kjv: 20 For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
verses.niv: 20 For where two or three come together in my name, there am I with them."

verses.esv: 17 So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.
verses.kjv: 17 So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
verses.niv: 17 Consequently, faith comes from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word of Christ.

verses.esv: 24 The God who made the world and everything in it, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by man,
verses.kjv: 24 God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
verses.niv: 24 "The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples built by hands.

verses.esv: 42 And they devoted themselves to the apostles’ teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.
verses.kjv: 42 And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
verses.niv: 42 They devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and to the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.

verses.esv: 14 I hope to come to you soon, but I am writing these things to you so that, 15 if I delay, you may know how one ought to behave in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, a pillar and buttress of the truth.
verses.kjv: 14 These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly: 15 But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.
verses.niv: 14 Although I hope to come to you soon, I am writing you these instructions so that, 15 if I am delayed, you will know how people ought to conduct themselves in God's household, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.

verses.esv: 12 And though a man might prevail against one who is alone, two will withstand him—a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.kjv: 12 And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.niv: 12 Though one may be overpowered, two can defend themselves. A cord of three strands is not quickly broken.

verses.esv: 14 And most of the brothers, having become confident in the Lord by my imprisonment, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
verses.kjv: 14 And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
verses.niv: 14 Because of my chains, most of the brothers in the Lord have been encouraged to speak the word of God more courageously and fearlessly.

verses.esv: 15 He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” 16 Simon Peter replied, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.” 17 And Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah! For flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven. 18 And I tell you, you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it. 19 I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.”
verses.kjv: 15 He saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am? 16 And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God. 17 And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Barjona: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven. 18 And I say also unto thee, That thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it. 19 And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.niv: 15 "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?" 16 Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God." 17 Jesus replied, "Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by man, but by my Father in heaven. 18 And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overcome it. 19 I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven."

verses.esv:
18   that they may know that you alone,
    whose name is the LORD,
    are the Most High over all the earth.
verses.kjv: 18 That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.
verses.niv: 18 Let them know that you, whose name is the LORD - that you alone are the Most High over all the earth.

verses.esv: 28 There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is no male and female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.kjv: 28 There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.niv: 28 There is neither Jew nor Greek, slave nor free, male nor female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.

verses.esv: 15 “So when you see the abomination of desolation spoken of by the prophet Daniel, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),
verses.kjv: 15 When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, stand in the holy place, (whoso readeth, let him understand:)
verses.niv: 15 "So when you see standing in the holy place 'the abomination that causes desolation,' spoken of through the prophet Daniel--let the reader understand--

verses.esv: 44 Then he said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything written about me in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms must be fulfilled.”
verses.kjv: 44 And he said unto them, These are the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.
verses.niv: 44 He said to them, "This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms."
